sentences.english: How do you feel about people with mental disabilities?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎樣看待有智障的人？

sentences.english: The handicapped also include deaf - mutes and some brain paralysis amentia .
sentences.chinese: 殘疾人還包括聾啞人及部分腦癱智障患者。

sentences.english: But Jenny has her heart set on attending one of the new college programs for students with intellectual disabilities.
sentences.chinese: 但珍妮一心想進爲智障學生新開設的大學班。

sentences.english: Huiling believed that persons with mental disabilities should live in society, much the same as ordinary people.
sentences.chinese: 慧靈相信智障人士應像普通人一樣在社會上生活。

sentences.english: Due to the presence of an extrachromosomal fragment, he suffered slight mental retardation.
sentences.chinese: 由於存在一個染色體外碎片，他有輕微的智障。

sentences.english: As his IQ drops, he knows he will once again be mentally challenged.
sentences.chinese: 智商漸減，他知道將會再度變爲智障。

sentences.english: The idea of permitting mentally disabled people to compete in sports was revolutionary at the time.
sentences.chinese: 允許智障人在體育競爭的想法，當時是革命性的。

sentences.english: She started the Special Olympics for athletes with mental disabilities.
sentences.chinese: 她爲智障運動員開創了特殊奧林匹克運動會。

sentences.english: Gang murders man then sues for compensation.
sentences.chinese: 江西人販謀殺智障漢僞造礦難騙取賠償。

sentences.english: I can clap with one hand. Just looks retarded. No benefits what soever.
sentences.chinese: 我能用單手鼓掌，看起來像是個智障，沒什麼好處。

sentences.english: Prenatal and infant exposure can cause mental retardation, deafness and blindness.
sentences.chinese: 胎兒及新生兒接觸汞會造成智障，耳聾，失明。

sentences.english: Bein' a idiot is a lot of fun when ain't nobody lookin'.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人盯著你瞧的時候，當個智障其實也蠻好玩的。

sentences.english: The research can provide some guidance for mentally retarded students' education.
sentences.chinese: 本研究結論可對智障學生的教育提供理論指導。

sentences.english: I discovered that in my community with mentally handicapped people.
sentences.chinese: 我在智障者的團契中發現了這點。

sentences.english: I didn't cry when I learned I was the parent of a mentally handicapped child.
sentences.chinese: 當我知道我是個智障兒的母親時，我沒有哭。

definition: (slang) (pun on 神經病|神经病[shen2 jing1 bing4]) crazy person/nutjob
(neologism c. 2017) adult who behaves in a childish manner (e.g. throwing a tantrum)
(neologism) strange behavior characteristic of a teenager going through puberty (loanword from Japanese "chūnibyō")
